qas.question: What kind of courts did congress establish?
What power are legislative courts not allowed to exercise?

answers.text: judicial power of the United States

qas.question: Which type of courts are established by Hoboken Land & Improvement CO.?
Which form do legislative courts take?
Which power of the United States may legislative courts exercise?
Which questions are legislative courts not able to adjudicate?
Which type of courts do legislative courts create in the form of judicial agencies?

context: <b6_0>Congress<b6_0/> may establish "<a0_0><b2_0>legislative courts<b2_0/><a0_0/>," which do not take the form of <b3_0>judicial agencies or commissions<b3_0/>, whose members do not have the same security of tenure or compensation as the constitutional court judges. Legislative courts may not exercise the <a1_0><b4_0>judicial power<b4_0/> of the United States<a1_0/>. In Murray's Lessee v. Hoboken Land & Improvement Co. (1856), the Supreme Court held that a legislative court may not decide "a suit at the common law, or in equity, or admiralty," as such a suit is inherently judicial. Legislative courts may only adjudicate "<b5_0>public rights" questions<b5_0/> (cases between the government and an individual and political determinations).
